item.description:
NO CARPOOL - MEET AT TRAILHEAD!

RESCHEDULED FOR FEB 16!

Lindt Chocolate & Wine Tasting!

We'll take a 2-hour hike or snowshoe, then head to Jewell Towne Vineyard for wine and chocolate!

Webster Wildlife and Natural Area is an 85-acre property owned by the Society for the Protection of NH Forests (SPNHF).

It was acquired in 1972 mainly because it contains a rare Atlantic-White-Cedar Swamp.

Atlantic White Cedars are very long-lived trees that may exceed 300 years of age. The oldest in NH is about 225 years old. AWC swamps are characterized by cool, dark forest floors lush with moses and liverworts. This will be a flat walk of a few miles.

Jewell Towne Vineyard is teaming up with Lindt Chocolate for a Valentine's tasting of wine and confections. They also have a beautiful, rustic-looking tasting room featuring a warm stove and the works of local artists on the walls.

No Pets.

Carpool: 10:40 AM @ Portsmouth Bus Station - 185 Grafton Ave. Take the 2nd right into the commuter lot. Meet at the very back of the lot. Call me if you can't find us!

Directions to Webster

GPS: 42.903138, -71.065654. These coordinates are for Kingston Dog Park. The trailhead is about 1/4mi further on the left.

Street: I-95 to Exit #1 for Seabrook/Kingston, NH. Follow Rt 107 West for 9 miles.

*Turn Left on Rts 111 & 125 South. Go 2 miles. *Turn Left on Folly Brook Terrace. *Immediately turn Right on Frontage Rd. *Go ~500' and turn left on unpaved Cedar Swamp Pond/Green Rd. *Go about 0.6 miles, past Kingston Dog Park, to a small parking area on the left.

The trailhead is a 40-min drive from Portsmouth or Newburyport.

Directions to Jewell Towne: Jewell Towne straddles the border between South Hampton, NH and Amesbury, MA. Set your GPS to: 183 Whitehall Road, Amesbury, MA.

Directions are on their website here.

Call the winery if you get lost: 603*394*0600

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.
Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Webster Walk, Wine...& Chocolate!
